unnormalised: **Energy & Utilities: Solar Rooftop Subsidies Boosted in New Initiative**
normalised: energy and utilities: solar rooftop subsidies boosted in new initiative

unnormalised: New Delhi â€“ The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) has announced a significant increase in subsidies for residential solar rooftop installations, effective immediately. Under the revamped Surya Ghar Yojana, individual households can now avail of subsidies up to 40% for rooftop solar systems up to 3 kW. For systems between 3 kW and 10 kW, the subsidy will be capped at Rs. 18,000 per kW.
normalised: new delhi - the ministry of new and renewable energy (M N R E) has announced a significant increase in subsidies for residential solar rooftop installations, effective immediately. under the revamped surya ghar yojana, individual households can now avail of subsidies up to forty percent for rooftop solar systems up to three kilowatt. for systems between three kilowatt and ten kilowatt, the subsidy will be capped at rupees eighteen thousand per kilowatt.

unnormalised: Dr. Anjali Sharma, Director of Renewable Energy at IIT Madras, hailed the move as a "game-changer," predicting a surge in adoption, particularly among middle-class families in urban areas like Mumbai and Bengaluru. The increased subsidy aims to alleviate the initial investment burden and encourage wider participation in sustainable energy practices.

unnormalised: The initiative targets installations covering at least 50,000 sq ft of rooftop space across the country in the next fiscal year. State nodal agencies like MEDA in Maharashtra will play a crucial role in disbursing the subsidies and ensuring smooth implementation. The government anticipates that this will reduce the carbon footprint and boost local manufacturing of solar panels, contributing to Atmanirbhar Bharat.
